alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 22 at 4:58PM CDT until March 25 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN SUMTER COUNTY... At 458 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Emelle, or 9 miles northwest of Livingston, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Emelle, Boyd, Sumterville and Payneville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
